patterns: What is the email of the professor?
What is the email of the TA?
responses: Professor's Email is anjum.chida@utdallas.edu and TA's Email is TBD
BigO of Binary Search O(log N)
Binary Search is a searching algorithm used in a sorted array by repeatedly dividing the search interval in half.

Merge Sort is a sorting algorithm based on divide and conquer approach, and it divides the array in half, continuously cuts down a list into multiple sublists until each has only one item, then merges those sublists into a sorted list.
BigO of Merge Sort O(N log(N))
Bubble Sort is a sorting algorithm that compares two adjacent elements and swaps them until they are in order and sorted.
BigO of Bubble Sort O(N^2)
Insertion Sort is a sorting algorithm that continously insert each element from an unsorted subarray into a sorted subarray.
BigO of Insertion Sort O(N^2)

Selection Sort is a sorting algorithm based on comparison and it adds one element in each iteration. The algorithm selects the smallest element in the array and move it to the beginning of the array by swapping with the first element.
BigO of Selection Sort O(N^2)

Heap sort is a comparison-based sorting technique based on Binary Heap data structure. It is similar to the selection sort where we first find the minimum element and place the minimum element at the beginning. Repeat the same process for the remaining elements.
BigO of Heap Sort O(N log(N))

patterns: What are the pre-requisites for this class?
responses: CS 3305 with C or better, and CE/CS/SE/TE 3345

patterns: What will we be learning in this class
responses: Asymptomatic analysis, recurrences,graph algorithms, and compitational complexity. Algorithm design techniques: greedy, method, dynamic programming, divide-and-conquer.

patterns: Will the lowest hw score be dropped?
responses: Lowest assignment score will be dropped. Students should not expect bonuses, make-ups, or other droped scores. Curving is not guaranteed

responses: Exam 3/the final is worth 25%.

patterns: How much is the homework worth?
responses: Homework assignments are worth 20%.

patterns: Will the exams be in class?
Where will the exams be held?
responses: All 3 exams will be in the Testing Center. Students MUST register/reserve seats at least 72 hours before the exam

patterns: Will there be make up exams?
Can I take a make up exam?
responses: Make up exams can be administered only for extreme circumstances like hospitalization or road accidents. Proof of incidence is required to request a make up exam.

patterns: Can homework be turned in late?
What's the penalty for late homework?
What's the penalty for late submission?
How many points are deducted for late homework?
responses: Late submissions will be accepted, but 10% of total score will be deducted. Submissions later than 48 hours will receive a 0.

responses: Available in E-learning multiple times throughout the semester.
Multiple times.
These quizzes aren't graded, but participation credit will be given if quizzes are attempted.

patterns: Will there be a grade for attendance?
responses: Regular and punctual class atendance is expected. Participation quizzes will be used to calculate participation credit.
